text.0: his life hath been renewed and carried forward as two men carborne by the skilful driver.
text.1: one falls then seeks the goal with quickened vigour let nirrti depart to distant places.
text.2: here is the psalm for wealth and food in plenty let us do many deeds to bring us glory.
text.3: all these our doings shall delight the singer let nirrti depart to distant places.
text.4: may we oercome our foes with acts of valour as heaven is over earth hills over lowlands.
text.5: all these our deeds the singer hath considered let nirrti depart to distant places.
text.6: give us not up as prey to death o soma still let us look upon the sun arising.
text.7: let our old age with passing days be kindly let nirrti depart to distant places.
text.8: o asuniti keep the soul within us and make the days we have to live yet longer.
text.9: grant that we still may look upon the sunlight strengthen thy body with the oil we bring thee.
text.10: give us our sight again o asuniti give us again our breath and our enjoyment.
text.11: long may we look upon the sun uprising o anumati favour thou and bless us.
text.12: may earth restore to us our vital spirit may heaven the goddess and midair restore it.
text.13: may soma give us once again our body and pūṣan show the path of peace and comfort.
text.14: may both worlds bless subandhu young mothers of everlasting law.
text.15: may heaven and earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.
text.16: healthgiving medicines descend sent down from heaven in twos and threes.
text.17: or wandering singly on the earth may heaven and earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.
text.18: drive forward thou the wagonox o indra which brought usinaranis wagon hither.
text.19: may heaven and earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.
